question.title: How many maritime piracy & armed robbery incidents will the International Maritime Bureau report for Q1 2026?
question.description:
In its annual report, the [International Maritime Bureau](https://icc-ccs.org) (IMB) [reported](https://icc-ccs.org/global-maritime-piracy-and-armed-robbery-increased-in-2025/) 137 maritime piracy and armed robbery incidents for 2025. The incident count maintains a concerning upward trend in piracy from 2024 (116), 2023 (120) and 2022 (41).

The IMB tracks incidents through its [Piracy Reporting Centre](https://icc-ccs.org/imb-piracy-reporting-centre-2/) which largely relies on in situ reports:

> Establish in 1992, IMB PRC offers a 24-hour and free service for shipmasters to report any piracy, armed robbery or stowaway incidents.

Maritime piracy and armed robbery are defined in Article 101 of the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) and IMO Resolution A.1025 (26) respectively. Under the definition, incidents such as the Houthi attacks on merchant ships in the Red Sea do not count.

Quarterly IMB data can be found below:

|   Year  | Cumulative Annual Incidents of Maritime Piracy and Armed Robbery |
| :-----: | :--------------------------------------------------------------: |
| 2023 Q1 |                                27                                |
| 2023 Q2 |                                 —                                |
| 2023 Q3 |                                99                                |
| 2023 Q4 |                                120                               |
| 2024 Q1 |                                33                                |
| 2024 Q2 |                                60                                |
| 2024 Q3 |                                79                                |
| 2024 Q4 |                                116                               |
| 2025 Q1 |                                45                                |
| 2025 Q2 |                                90                                |
| 2025 Q3 |                                116                               |
| 2025 Q4 |                                137                               |

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":42024,"question_id":41758}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the number of maritime piracy and armed robbery incidents that take place during Q1 2026, according to the [International Maritime Bureau](https://icc-ccs.org/news/) (IMB) in its Q1 2026 quarterly report.
question.fine_print:
If the International Maritime Bureau does not release its Q1 2026 report or the data is otherwise unavailable before May 1, 2026, this question will be annulled.

***
This question's information (resolution criteria, fine print, background info, etc) is synced with an [original identical question](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/42024) which opened on 2026-02-11 17:00:00. This question will resolve based on the resolution criteria and fine print contained above. However, if this question would resolve differently than the original question, then this question will be annulled. Additionally, if the original question's resolution could have been known before this question opened, then this question will be annulled.
